alert.note: Alert for Middlesex; New Haven (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 13 at 6:51AM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Eastern New Haven county and Middlesex county in southern Connecticut. * WHEN...Until 1000 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 651 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Overflowing poor drainage areas will cause minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 1/2 and 1 inch rain has fallen, with some locally higher amounts of 1 to 2 inches near the coastline. - Some locations that could experience flooding include... New Haven, Middletown, Wallingford, Guilford, Colchester, Clinton, East Hampton, Old Saybrook, Durham, Salem, Chester, Hamden, Cheshire, Branford, North Haven, North Branford, East Haddam, Haddam, Westbrook and Killingworth. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
